ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/fireside-forum-on-sustainability-tickets-169861080063

As part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, Northumberland - Peterborough South is hosting a debate on the environment. The intent of this debate is to allow you to listen to the 2021 Federal Candidates in Northumberland - Peterborough South present their positions on the environmental issues which we feel are critical to your voting decision this September. Please join us.

This debate will be an online Debate.

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/3yyB3A7

All- Candidates Debate on Climate Crisis and the Environment by in the Cowichan-Malahat-Langford riding , Sept. 8 on Zoom/Facebook Live.

This event has a simple mission: to make the environment an issue that no party and no candidate can ignore by organizing non-partisan, all-candidates in debates on the environment in ridings across Canada.

In October 2019, was the first 100 Debates. Local community organizers held 104 candidates debates launching a nation-wide conversation that brought climate change and policy to the forefront of the election, fostered environmental leadership, and accountability in federal politics.

We're ready to do it again! The 2021 100 Debates on the Environment will take place on: Sept. 8, 2021 7 pm on zoom with all candidates from the Cowhichan, Malahat and Langford riding.

See the re-cap of 2019: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dNFr0ZhsIxo&t=131s

ad_creative_link_caption: L'Environnement, parlons-en : Débat électoral dans Laurier–Sainte-Marie
ad_creative_link_captions: L'Environnement, parlons-en : Débat électoral dans Laurier–Sainte-Marie
ad_creative_link_description:
Partout au Canada, le 8 et le 9 septembre, se tiendront 100 débats non partisans sur l'environnement, dans autant de circonscriptions. C'est l'occasion d'entendre les idées et propositions de vos candidat.e.s sur les enjeux environnementaux, la relance juste de l’économie et la réconciliation avec les peuples autochtones, afin de faire un choix éclairé le jour de l'élection le 20 septembre.

Quand? Jeudi le 9 septembre 2021, de 18h30 à 20h30

Où? Zoom et diffusion en direct (plus de détails à venir). La vidéo sera disponible après le débat.

Billets? Gratuit et ouvert à tout le monde. Veuillez confirmer votre présence avec Eventbrite pour obtenir le lien Zoom.
https://100debatslaurierstemarie.eventbrite.ca/

Candidates et candidats?
    Jean-Michel Lavarenne (vert), présence confirmée
    Marie-Ève-Lyne Michel (bloc), présence confirmée
    Nimâ Machouf (néo-démocrate), présence confirmée
    Ronan Reich (conservateur)
    Steven Guilbeault (libéral), présence confirmée

Animateurs? Mélody Porlier et Dan Kneeshaw

« L’environnement, parlons-en » est une tribune non partisane, coordonnée par GreenPAC et axée sur les solutions, s’adressant aux Canadien.nes qui veulent voir nos leaders politiques collaborer à la mise en place d’un avenir sain et sécuritaire pour l’environnement.

Ce débat est présenté par la Coalition climat Montréal, 500 Women Scientists Montréal, Pour nos enfants Montréal, Mères au front Montréal, et Justice climatique Montréal.

Cet événement est ouvert à tout le monde. Nous encourageons particulièrement les jeunes et d'autres futurs électeurs à participer.

-------------------------------------------
Veuillez noter : Ce débat concerne la circonscription de Laurier--Sainte-Marie. Trouvez d'autres circonscriptions à https://www.100debates.ca/ ou inscrivez-vous pour en organiser une. De nouveaux débats s'ajoutent chaque jour.

Cet événement aura lieu à Tiohtiá:ke / Montréal, qui est situé en territoire autochtone et non cédé. Nous reconnaissons et respectons les Kanien'kehá: ka en tant que gardiens traditionnels de ces terres et ces eaux.

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/3gZeXAD

Watch your federal Scarborough Southwest candidates in a virtual Debate on the Environment.

Want to know more about how our next government will tackle climate change? Concerned about how the climate crisis will impact our economy and affordability? Wondering about how the environment affects our health and what we're going to do about it?

Join us for our virtual Debate on the Environment where we will be hearing from our local Scarborough Southwest candidates on these topics and more.

RSVP for your ticket on Eventbrite to obtain the Zoom link, or you can watch it on Facebook as we will be live streaming. Can’t attend? We will be posting the recording once the debate has been completed.

THANKS TO PRESENTING SPONSOR
Vancity Community Investment Bank

Our debate is part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, a national non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC.

100 Debates on the Environment brings together community groups, non-profits, businesses and individuals who are working to increase the level of environmental leadership in Canada by holding 100 strictly non-partisan all-candidate debates on the environment before the next election.

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/php100debates

100 Debates on the Environment is a national initiative to hold non-partisan all-candidates debates on the environment in 100 ridings.
About this event
The people of Parkdale-High Park care deeply about the environment. Hear where our federal candidates stand on these pressing issues leading up to the federal election.

Please join GreenPac, Parkdale High-Park for Climate Action, Green13, Green Parkdale Roncesvalles, Roncy Reduces, Safe Rail Communities, the Junction Residents Association and Neighbourhood Energy Solutions for a virtual all-candidates debate on the environment.

THANKS TO OUR PRESENTING SPONSOR
Vancity Community Investment Bank

September 8, 2021

6pm-8pm

Candidates:
• Diem Marchand-Lafortune - Green Party of Canada
• Nestor Sanajko - Conservative Party of Canada
• Paul Taylor - New Democratic Party
• Arif Virani - Liberal Party of Canada

Thank you!

The Parkdale-High Park 100 Debates Organizing Team

This event is sponsored by Vancity Community Investment Bank

“Join us virtually for our virtual Debate on the Environment. RSVP for your ticket to obtain the zoom link, or you can watch on Facebook.
About this event
This event is part of the pan-Canadian and non-partisan initiative, 100 Debates on the Environment, led by GreenPAC in partnership with Canadian organizations and individuals across the country.

This event was organized by Windsor On Watch, Fridays For Future Windsor-Essex, Windsor Essex Youth Climate Council and the Council of Canadians.

Find out what commitments our Windsor-West candidates are making to create a net zero emissions future, safeguard the environment, build a green and just recovery from COVID-19, and further national Indigenous healing and reconciliation.

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/3jB37hK

The federal election is under way and Canadians know that if we want a chance at building a better future, we need our leaders to ensure immediate, ambitious and concrete action for the environment. Canadians deserve more than empty promises and outdated ways of thinking about the earth and our economy. We deserve true leadership and transformative change.

That is why the Ecology Action Centre is hosting a virtual, all-party debate on the environment in partnership with the Ummah Masjid And Community Center on Wednesday September 8th from 6:30 PM- 8:30 PM to hear parties' positions on critical issues related to the biodiversity and climate crises. Our debate is part of the 100 Debates on the Environment, a national, non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC. 100 debates' mission is simple: to make the environment an issue that no party and no candidate can ignore. 

Register to receive the zoom link. The debate will also be streamed live on our YouTube. 

Can't make it? We will be posting the recording once the debate has been completed.

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/3zFkvaR

Curious about what London is doing to protect our planet against climate change? 🌎 Then join us for our Meet and Greet with our London MP candidates!

Hear your local candidates' plans for the future of our environment. This is an opportunity for candidates to join a
national conversation at the local level. To spread hope and talk about what the future looks like if we get it right.
The event will feature candidates from the London Fanshawe, London North Centre, and London West ridings. Each candidate will present their climate plan, followed by a Q&A session with the audience after each riding. You won't want to miss it!

6:30-7:00pm - London Fanshawe (confirmed: Lindsay Mathyssen (NDP)
7:00-7:30pm - London North Centre (confirmed: Peter Fragiskatos (Liberal), Mary Ann Hodge (Green), Dirka Prout (NDP)
7:30-8:00pm - London West (confirmed: Shawna Lewkowitz (NDP), Arielle Kayabaga (Liberal)

This event is a part of GreenPAC's 100 Debates on the Environment.

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/38uyRyT

Sign up to see the Brampton East candidates participate in an environmentally-oriented debate ahead of the upcoming federal election.

The debate in Brampton East will be part of the 100 Debates on the Environment project, which is coordinating virtual debates in ridings across our country. 100 Debates on the Environment is a non-partisan project that aims to bring voters together at the riding level to hear candidates best policy ideas for the environment. Candidates representing major political parties are invited to participate in each debate.

The environment is a top issue for Canadians. This is an opportunity for candidates to join a national conversation at the local level. To spread hope and talk about what the future looks like if we get it right. And to talk about actionable policy ideas and explain how your plan gets us closer to that kind of future. This is a debate about all the reasons why the environment must be front and center in any government’s plan for post-pandemic economic recovery, national healing and reconciliation.

Where do your candidates stand on YOUR issues?

Join us for our virtual Debate on the Environment. RSVP for your FREE ticket on Eventbrite to obtain the zoom link.
Please join Halton Environmental Network (HEN) on Wednesday September 8th, 2021 at 8 pm.

From preserving our green spaces to helping to fight climate change, hear candidates representing major political parties discuss their best policy ideas and answer questions about critical issues about the environment. This is your opportunity to meet and listen to your Federal Election Candidates. We will be asking questions provide to us from GreenPac these questions will be the same questions being asked of Candidates from across Canada!

To submit your questions for the Debate, so come don’t forget to ask your question in advance here: https://www.menti.com/yxpxhg3ifw
HEN, CFUW, GASP, HACEN and other volunteers will be adjudicating all community questions the most common questions will be asked to all Candidate. We will be launching polls during the live debate too so come prepared to be engaged!

Our debate is part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, a national non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC. HEN would to thank all the dedicated volunteers from GASP, CFUW Oakville, HACEN, Generation Green supporting and making this event a reality in our community!
For more information please check out our website for details: https://haltonenvironet.ca/100-debate-on-environment-2021/

ad_creative_link_captions: Election 2021 and the Climate Emergency: South Okanagan-West Kootenay Forum
ad_creative_link_description:
Concerned about the climate crisis? Federal candidates will have an opportunity to discuss climate issues in an online all-candidates forum on September 7 (6-8 pm) for the South Okanagan—West Kootenay riding.

The riding-wide forum, Election 2021 and the Climate Emergency, is being organized by two non-partisan local organizations — Fridays For Future West Kootenay and the Nelson-West Kootenay chapter of Citizens’ Climate Lobby. It is also taking place as part of GreenPAC’s 100 Debates on the Environment, with similar forums happening in communities across Canada around the same time.

It will take place on Zoom, and registration is required: https://bit.ly/SOWK-ClimateForum

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Here: https://bit.ly/3yuTcyR

Join us on Zoom to hear about the environment from the candidates vying to represent Cambridge in the election. This debate, which is one of 100 Debates on the Environment, will focus on the candidates' positions on environmental issues including the climate crisis, greenhouse gas emissions and biodiversity conservation.

The debate will be moderated by Mike Farwell, host of The Mike Farwell Show on 570 News.

Candidates for Cambridge:

Michele Braniff (Green)

Lorne Bruce (NDP) - ATTENDANCE TO BE CONFIRMED

Connie Cody (Conservative) - ATTENDANCE TO BE CONFIRMED

Bryan May (Liberal) - ATTENDANCE TO BE CONFIRMED

This debate is co-hosted by rare Charitable Research Reserve and Reep Green Solutions as part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, a national non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC.

About 100 Debates
100 Debates on the Environment brings together community groups, non-profits, businesses and individuals who are working to increase the level of environmental leadership in Canada by holding 100 strictly non-partisan all-candidate debates on the environment before the next election.

https://www.100debates.ca/debates

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/3kBIx0m

Where do the Ottawa Centre candidates stand on issues of the environment?

Join us for a virtual debate on the environment with the candidates of Ottawa Centre in Canada’s 44th federal election. This event is part of the pan-Canadian and non-partisan initiative, 100 Debates on the Environment, led by GreenPAC in partnership with Canadian organizations and individuals across the country. The 2021 Ottawa Centre debate is hosted by Evidence for Democracy, Canada’s leading non-partisan, not-for-profit organization promoting the transparent use of evidence in government decision-making.

Hear where the candidates stand on science and environmental policy, from climate change to conservation and more. Come get to know your potential next Member of Parliament representing Ottawa Centre!

The 2021 Federal Candidates for Ottawa Centre:
Angela Keller-Herzog (Green Party)
Angella MacEwen (NDP)
Carol Clemenhagen (Conservative Party) — Attendance to be confirmed
Yasir Naqvi (Liberal Party)

The debate moderator is to be confirmed.

RSVP for your ticket on Eventbrite to get the Zoom link, or watch the livestream (details to be announced).

Can’t attend? The recording will be made available after the debate.

Nature NB and UNB Sustainability will be hosting 100 Debates on the Environment ahead of the 2021 federal election in Canada. Candidates will respond to a variety of questions related to the environment, addressing both federal and local concerns. Moderated by Dr. Don Wright, Chair of the Political Science department at UNB Fredericton.
Please note: This debate is for the Fredericton riding.

Nature NB et UNB Sustainability organisent L'environnement, parlons-en à l'approche des élections fédérales de 2021 au Canada. Les candidats répondront à une variété de questions liées à l'environnement, en abordant les préoccupations fédérales et locales. Animé par le Dr Don Wright, président du département de sciences politiques de l'UNB Fredericton.
Veuillez noter : Ce débat concerne la circonscription de Fredericton.

From preserving our green spaces to helping to fight climate change, hear candidates representing major political parties discuss their best policy ideas and answer questions about critical issues about the environment. This is your opportunity to meet and listen to your Federal Election Candidates. We will be asking questions provide to us from GreenPac these questions will be the same questions being asked of Candidates from across Canada!

To submit your questions for the Debate, so come don’t forget to ask your question in advance here: https://www.menti.com/ufo5551ryw
HEN, CFUW Oakville and other volunteers will be adjudicating all community questions the most common questions will be asked to all Candidates. We will be launching polls during the live debate too so come prepared to be engaged!

Our debate is part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, a national non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC. HEN would thank all the dedicated volunteers for supporting and making this event a reality in our community!

For more information please check out our website for details: https://haltonenvironet.ca/100-debate-on-environment-2021/

ad_creative_link_caption: Election 2021 and the Climate Emergency: Kootenay-Columbia Forum
ad_creative_link_captions: Election 2021 and the Climate Emergency: Kootenay-Columbia Forum
ad_creative_link_description:
Concerned about the climate crisis? Federal candidates will have an opportunity to discuss climate issues in an online all-candidates forum on September 8 (6-8 pm) for the Kootenay—Columbia riding.

The riding-wide forum, Election 2021 and the Climate Emergency, is being organized by two non-partisan local organizations — Fridays For Future West Kootenay and the Nelson-West Kootenay chapter of Citizens’ Climate Lobby. It is also taking place as part of GreenPAC’s 100 Debates on the Environment, with similar forums happening in communities across Canada around the same time.

It will take place on Zoom, and registration is required: https://bit.ly/KC-ClimateForum

ad_creative_link_caption: 100 Debates on the Environment - Calgary Centre
ad_creative_link_captions: 100 Debates on the Environment - Calgary Centre
ad_creative_link_description:
EWB Calgary is thrilled to host the 100 Debates on the Environment and More for Calgary's most contested constituency ahead of the 44th Canadian federal, and Canada's first pandemic, election. 

Register here: https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/calgary-centre-100in1-debate-elxn-44-tickets-168373705285?aff=ebdsoporgprofile 

Calgary-Centre has historically always been known for its close calls when it comes to election season. For the next election, the constituency is once again forecasting a tight race. So we, in partnership with many other Calgary-based organizations, are bringing you a debate amongst the candidates to help you make a more informed decision when you head to the polls on September 20.

To ensure your safety amidst the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, the debate will be delivered in a virtual fashion. Stay tuned for more details including how you can tune in, ask questions, and make the most out of this critical debate.

This Zoom debate is part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, a national non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC.

The people of Parkdale-High Park care deeply about the environment. Hear where our federal candidates stand on these pressing issues leading up to the federal election.

Please join GreenPac, Parkdale High-Park for Climate Action, Green13, Green Parkdale Roncesvalles, Roncy Reduces, Safe Rail Communities, the Junction Residents Association and Neighbourhood Energy Solutions for a virtual all-candidates debate on the environment.

• Paul Taylor - New Democratic Party
• Arif Virani - Liberal Party of Canada

Thank you!

The Parkdale-High Park 100 Debates Organizing Team

This event is sponsored by Vancity Community Investment Bank

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/3jum8m1

Find out where the Kitchener-Conestoga Federal election candidates stand on the environment.
About this event
Join us on Zoom to hear about the environment from the candidates vying to represent Kitchener-Conestoga in the election. This debate, which is one of 100 Debates on the Environment across Canada, will focus on the candidates' positions on environmental issues including the climate crisis, greenhouse gas emissions and biodiversity conservation.

The debate will be moderated by Tova Davidson, Executive Director, Sustainable Waterloo Region. 

This debate is co-hosted by rare Charitable Research Reserve, Reep Green Solutions, Waterloo Region Nature, Grand River Environmental Network, Nith Valley EcoBoosters, Sustainable Waterloo Region and GreenPAC as part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, a national non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC.

100 Debates on the Environment brings together community groups, non-profits, businesses and individuals who are working to increase the level of environmental leadership in Canada by holding 100 strictly non-partisan all-candidate debates on the environment before the next election.

https://www.100debates.ca/debates

ad_creative_link_captions: 100 Debates on the Environment - Toronto—St. Paul's
ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/3mNzDzd

Join us on September 9, 7 -8:30 pm for a virtual, non-partisan debate on the environment held for candidates in Toronto-St. Paul's riding
About this event
100 Debates on the Environment: Toronto-St. Paul's Riding

Where do the Toronto-St. Paul's candidates stand on issues of the climate, a just transition, and national Indigenous healing and reconciliation?

The impacts of climate change are present and intensifying here in Canada: heat domes, wildfires, flooding, drought. The recent report from the IPCC painted a clear picture of a "code red" for humanity -- a call for immediate, emergency action.

Find out what commitments our Toronto-St. Paul's candidates are making to create a net zero emissions future, safeguard the environment, build a green and just recovery from COVID-19, and further national Indigenous healing and reconciliation.

THANKS TO PRESENTING SPONSOR:
Vancity Community Investment Bank

This event is part of the pan-Canadian and non-partisan initiative, 100 Debates on the Environment, led by GreenPAC in partnership with Canadian organizations and individuals across the country. The 2021 University-Rosedale debate is hosted by ClimateFast and For Our Kids. Our moderator is Richard Sandbrook, President, Science for Peace.

Register now for your link to the debate and to let us know what issues you would like to see the candidates address. Your input will help us focus the debate on the environmental concerns that matter to Toronto-St. Paul's constituents.

Can’t attend? The recording will be made available after the debate.

Thank you from the Toronto St. Paul's organizing team

Lyn Adamson, ClimateFast www.climatefast.ca

Brianne Whyte, For our Kids, www.forourkids.ca

Daniel Jubas-Malz

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/3gNNKkp

100 Debates on the Environment is a national initiative to hold non-partisan all-candidates debates on the environment in 100 ridings.
About this event
The people of Parkdale-High Park care deeply about the environment. Hear where our federal candidates stand on these pressing issues leading up to the federal election.

Please join GreenPac, Parkdale High-Park for Climate Action, Green13, Green Parkdale Roncesvalles, Roncy Reduces, Safe Rail Communities, the Junction Residents Association and Neighbourhood Energy Solutions for a virtual all-candidates debate on the environment.

September 8, 2021

6pm-8pm

Candidates:
Diem Marchand-Lafortune (Green Party)
Paul Taylor (New Democratic Party)
Arif Virani (Liberal Party)
Conservative Party candidate (tbd)

Thank you!

The Parkdale-High Park 100 Debates Organizing Team

This event is sponsored by Vancity Community Investment Bank

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/3zgpxdI

Where do your candidates stand on YOUR issues?

Join us for our virtual Debate on the Environment. RSVP for your FREE ticket on Eventbrite to obtain the zoom link.
Please join Halton Environmental Network (HEN) on Wednesday September 8th, 2021 at 8 pm.

From preserving our green spaces to helping to fight climate change, hear candidates representing major political parties discuss their best policy ideas and answer questions about critical issues about the environment. This is your opportunity to meet and listen to your Federal Election Candidates. We will be asking questions provide to us from GreenPAC these questions will be the same questions being asked of Candidates from across Canada!

To submit your questions for the Debate, so come don’t forget to ask your question in advance here: https://www.menti.com/rftwrbr1v6
HEN, CFUW, GASP, HACEN and other volunteers will be adjudicating all community questions the most common questions will be asked to all Candidate. We will be launching polls during the live debate too so come prepared to be engaged!

Our debate is part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, a national non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC. HEN would to thank all the dedicated volunteers from GASP, CFUW Oakville, HACEN, Generation Green supporting and making this event a reality in our community!
For more information please check out our website for details: https://haltonenvironet.ca/100-debate-on-environment-2021/

From preserving our green spaces to helping to fight climate change, hear candidates representing major political parties discuss their best policy ideas and answer questions about critical issues about the environment. This is your opportunity to meet and listen to your Federal Election Candidates. We will be asking questions provide to us from GreenPac these questions will be the same questions being asked of Candidates from across Canada!

To submit your questions for the Debate, so come don’t forget to ask your question in advance here: https://www.menti.com/yxpxhg3ifw
HEN, CFUW, GASP, HACEN and other volunteers will be adjudicating all community questions the most common questions will be asked to all Candidate. We will be launching polls during the live debate too so come prepared to be engaged!

Our debate is part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, a national non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC. HEN would to thank all the dedicated volunteers from GASP, CFUW Oakville, HACEN, Generation Green supporting and making this event a reality in our community!
For more information please check out our website for details: https://haltonenvironet.ca/100-debate-on-environment-2021/

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/3kBIx0m

Where do the Ottawa Centre candidates stand on issues of the environment?

Join us for a virtual debate on the environment with the candidates of Ottawa Centre in Canada’s 44th federal election. This event is part of the pan-Canadian and non-partisan initiative, 100 Debates on the Environment, led by GreenPAC in partnership with Canadian organizations and individuals across the country. The 2021 Ottawa Centre debate is hosted by Evidence for Democracy, Canada’s leading non-partisan, not-for-profit organization promoting the transparent use of evidence in government decision-making.

Hear where the candidates stand on science and environmental policy, from climate change to conservation and more. Come get to know your potential next Member of Parliament representing Ottawa Centre!

The 2021 Federal Candidates for Ottawa Centre:
Angela Keller-Herzog (Green Party)
Angella MacEwen (NDP)
Carol Clemenhagen (Conservative Party) — Attendance to be confirmed
Yasir Naqvi (Liberal Party)

The debate moderator is to be confirmed.

RSVP for your ticket on Eventbrite to get the Zoom link, or watch the livestream (details to be announced).

Can’t attend? The recording will be made available after the debate.

Join us on Zoom to hear about the environment from the candidates vying to represent Cambridge in the election. This debate, which is one of 100 Debates on the Environment, will focus on the candidates' positions on environmental issues including the climate crisis, greenhouse gas emissions and biodiversity conservation.

The debate will be moderated by Mike Farwell, host of The Mike Farwell Show on 570 News.

Candidates for Cambridge:

Michele Braniff (Green)

Lorne Bruce (NDP) - ATTENDANCE TO BE CONFIRMED

Connie Cody (Conservative) - ATTENDANCE TO BE CONFIRMED

Bryan May (Liberal) - ATTENDANCE TO BE CONFIRMED

This debate is co-hosted by rare Charitable Research Reserve and Reep Green Solutions as part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, a national non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC.

ad_creative_link_caption: Election 2021 and the Climate Emergency: South Okanagan-West Kootenay Forum
ad_creative_link_captions: Election 2021 and the Climate Emergency: South Okanagan-West Kootenay Forum
ad_creative_link_description:
Concerned about the climate crisis? Federal candidates will have an opportunity to discuss climate issues in an online all-candidates forum on September 7 (6-8 pm) for the South Okanagan—West Kootenay riding.

The riding-wide forum, Election 2021 and the Climate Emergency, is being organized by two non-partisan local organizations — Fridays For Future West Kootenay and the Nelson-West Kootenay chapter of Citizens’ Climate Lobby. It is also taking place as part of GreenPAC’s 100 Debates on the Environment, with similar forums happening in communities across Canada around the same time.

It will take place on Zoom, and registration is required: https://bit.ly/SOWK-ClimateForum

Join us virtually for our online All Candidates Debate on the Environment, Health and Climate for Esquimalt Saanich Sooke.

Click green register button on this page for your free ticket to attend this webinar debate and to obtain the zoom link or you can live stream the webinar debate on Facebook.

We are seeking questions from the Esquimalt Saanich Sooke audience about the environment and climate.

Send a question for your debate candidates by email to 100DebatesMetchosin@gmail.com.

Unable to attend? Check 100Debates.ca to access a recording of the debate.

Our debate is part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, a national non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC.

Any remaining questions Canadians had about the climate crisis were settled these past months with the scorching heat dome, six hundred dead, widespread drought, extreme wildfires with the world's worst air pollution recorded in Vancouver and flooding. The time is now for our elected representatives in Ottawa to take bold action. Let's hear their plans.

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/3mNzDzd

Join us on September 9, 7 -8:30 pm for a virtual, non-partisan debate on the environment held for candidates in Toronto-St. Paul's riding
About this event
100 Debates on the Environment: Toronto-St. Paul's Riding

Where do the Toronto-St. Paul's candidates stand on issues of the climate, a just transition, and national Indigenous healing and reconciliation?

The impacts of climate change are present and intensifying here in Canada: heat domes, wildfires, flooding, drought. The recent report from the IPCC painted a clear picture of a "code red" for humanity -- a call for immediate, emergency action.

Find out what commitments our Toronto-St. Paul's candidates are making to create a net zero emissions future, safeguard the environment, build a green and just recovery from COVID-19, and further national Indigenous healing and reconciliation.

This event is part of the pan-Canadian and non-partisan initiative, 100 Debates on the Environment, led by GreenPAC in partnership with Canadian organizations and individuals across the country. The 2021 University-Rosedale debate is hosted by ClimateFast and For Our Kids. Our moderator is Richard Sandbrook, President, Science for Peace.

Register now for your link to the debate and to let us know what issues you would like to see the candidates address. Your input will help us focus the debate on the environmental concerns that matter to Toronto-St. Paul's constituents.

Can’t attend? The recording will be made available after the debate.

Thank you from the Toronto St. Paul's organizing team

Lyn Adamson, ClimateFast www.climatefast.ca

Brianne Whyte, For our Kids, www.forourkids.ca

Daniel Jubas-Malz

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/3yeuna8

Where do your candidates stand on YOUR issues?

Join us for our virtual Debate on the Environment. RSVP for your FREE ticket on Eventbrite to obtain the zoom link.
Please join Halton Environmental Network (HEN) and CFUW Oakville on Wednesday, September 8th, 2021 at 8 pm.

From preserving our green spaces to helping to fight climate change, hear candidates representing major political parties discuss their best policy ideas and answer questions about critical issues about the environment and other critical issues. This is your opportunity to meet and listen to your Federal Election Candidates. We will be asking questions provide to us from GreenPAC these questions will be the same questions being asked of Candidates from across Canada!

To submit your questions for the Debate, so come don’t forget to ask your question in advance here: 
https://www.menti.com/ufo5551ryw
HEN, CFUW Oakville and other volunteers will be adjudicating all community questions the most common questions will be asked to all Candidates. We will be launching polls during the live debate too so come prepared to be engaged!

Oakville Chapter, Canadian Federation of University Women (CFUW) will bring questions for candidates about other priority issues for Canadians. Issues include the economy, child care, health and long-term care and others. These questions will broaden the platform issues for candidates to address and help voters in Oakville riding to make informed choices.

Our debate is part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, a national non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC. HEN would thank all the dedicated volunteers for supporting and making this event a reality in our community!

For more information please check out our website for details: https://haltonenvironet.ca/100-debate-on-environment-2021/

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/3zy8uUu

100 Debates on the Environment: University-Rosedale, Toronto

Where do the University-Rosedale candidates stand on issues of the environment, a just transition, and national Indigenous healing and reconciliation?

The impacts of climate change are present and intensifying here in Canada: heat domes, wildfires, flooding, drought. The recent report from the IPCC painted a clear picture of a "code red" for humanity -- a call for immediate, emergency action.

Find out what commitments our University-Rosedale candidates are making to create a net zero emissions future, safeguard the environment, build a green and just recovery from COVID-19, and further national Indigenous healing and reconciliation.

This event is part of the pan-Canadian and non-partisan initiative, 100 Debates on the Environment, led by GreenPAC in partnership with Canadian organizations and individuals across the country. The 2021 University-Rosedale debate is hosted by ClimateFast, Green11, and Trinity St. Paul’s United Church. Our moderator is Aliénor Rougeot, Program Manager, Climate and Energy, Environmental Defence.

The 2021 Federal Candidates for University-Rosedale are:

Chrystia Freeland (Liberal Party)
Nicole Robicheau (New Democratic Party)
Stephen Taylor (Conservative Party)
Tim Grant (Green Party)

ad_creative_link_descriptions:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/3zy8uUu

100 Debates on the Environment: University-Rosedale, Toronto

Where do the University-Rosedale candidates stand on issues of the environment, a just transition, and national Indigenous healing and reconciliation?

The impacts of climate change are present and intensifying here in Canada: heat domes, wildfires, flooding, drought. The recent report from the IPCC painted a clear picture of a "code red" for humanity -- a call for immediate, emergency action.

Find out what commitments our University-Rosedale candidates are making to create a net zero emissions future, safeguard the environment, build a green and just recovery from COVID-19, and further national Indigenous healing and reconciliation.

This event is part of the pan-Canadian and non-partisan initiative, 100 Debates on the Environment, led by GreenPAC in partnership with Canadian organizations and individuals across the country. The 2021 University-Rosedale debate is hosted by ClimateFast, Green11, and Trinity St. Paul’s United Church. Our moderator is Aliénor Rougeot, Program Manager, Climate and Energy, Environmental Defence.

The 2021 Federal Candidates for University-Rosedale are:

Chrystia Freeland (Liberal Party)
Nicole Robicheau (New Democratic Party)
Stephen Taylor (Conservative Party)
Tim Grant (Green Party)
(Candidate attendance is still to be confirmed.)

Register now for your link to the debate and to let us know what issues you would like to see the candidates address. Your input will help us focus the debate on the environmental concerns that matter to University-Rosedale constituents.

Can’t attend? The recording will be made available after the debate.

Find out where the Kitchener-Conestoga Federal election candidates stand on the environment.
About this event
Join us on Zoom to hear about the environment from the candidates vying to represent Kitchener-Conestoga in the election. This debate, which is one of 100 Debates on the Environment across Canada, will focus on the candidates' positions on environmental issues including the climate crisis, greenhouse gas emissions and biodiversity conservation.

The debate will be moderated by Tova Davidson, Executive Director, Sustainable Waterloo Region. 

This debate is co-hosted by rare Charitable Research Reserve, Reep Green Solutions, Waterloo Region Nature, Grand River Environmental Network, Nith Valley EcoBoosters, Sustainable Waterloo Region and GreenPAC as part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, a national non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC.

100 Debates on the Environment brings together community groups, non-profits, businesses and individuals who are working to increase the level of environmental leadership in Canada by holding 100 strictly non-partisan all-candidate debates on the environment before the next election.

https://www.100debates.ca/debates

ad_creative_link_captions: 100 Debates on the Environment - Calgary Centre
ad_creative_link_description:
EWB Calgary is thrilled to host the 100 Debates on the Environment and More for Calgary's most contested constituency ahead of the 44th Canadian federal, and Canada's first pandemic, election. 

Register here: https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/calgary-centre-100in1-debate-elxn-44-tickets-168373705285?aff=ebdsoporgprofile 

Calgary-Centre has historically always been known for its close calls when it comes to election season. For the next election, the constituency is once again forecasting a tight race. So we, in partnership with many other Calgary-based organizations, are bringing you a debate amongst the candidates to help you make a more informed decision when you head to the polls on September 20.

To ensure your safety amidst the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, the debate will be delivered in a virtual fashion. Stay tuned for more details including how you can tune in, ask questions, and make the most out of this critical debate.

This Zoom debate is part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, a national non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC.

ad_creative_link_captions: Election 2021 and the Climate Emergency: Kootenay-Columbia Forum
ad_creative_link_description:
Concerned about the climate crisis? Federal candidates will have an opportunity to discuss climate issues in an online all-candidates forum on September 8 (6-8 pm) for the Kootenay—Columbia riding.

The riding-wide forum, Election 2021 and the Climate Emergency, is being organized by two non-partisan local organizations — Fridays For Future West Kootenay and the Nelson-West Kootenay chapter of Citizens’ Climate Lobby. It is also taking place as part of GreenPAC’s 100 Debates on the Environment, with similar forums happening in communities across Canada around the same time.

It will take place on Zoom, and registration is required: https://bit.ly/KC-ClimateForum

Register Now: https://bit.ly/3zgpxdI

Where do your candidates stand on YOUR issues?

Join us for our virtual Debate on the Environment. RSVP for your FREE ticket on Eventbrite to obtain the zoom link.
Please join Halton Environmental Network (HEN) on Wednesday September 8th, 2021 at 8 pm.

From preserving our green spaces to helping to fight climate change, hear candidates representing major political parties discuss their best policy ideas and answer questions about critical issues about the environment. This is your opportunity to meet and listen to your Federal Election Candidates. We will be asking questions provide to us from GreenPAC these questions will be the same questions being asked of Candidates from across Canada!

To submit your questions for the Debate, so come don’t forget to ask your question in advance here: https://www.menti.com/rftwrbr1v6
HEN, CFUW, GASP, HACEN and other volunteers will be adjudicating all community questions the most common questions will be asked to all Candidate. We will be launching polls during the live debate too so come prepared to be engaged!

Our debate is part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, a national non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC. HEN would to thank all the dedicated volunteers from GASP, CFUW Oakville, HACEN, Generation Green supporting and making this event a reality in our community!
For more information please check out our website for details: https://haltonenvironet.ca/100-debate-on-environment-2021/

ad_creative_link_description:
Register Now: https://bit.ly/3kBIx0m

Where do the Ottawa Centre candidates stand on issues of the environment?

Join us for a virtual debate on the environment with the candidates of Ottawa Centre in Canada’s 44th federal election. This event is part of the pan-Canadian and non-partisan initiative, 100 Debates on the Environment, led by GreenPAC in partnership with Canadian organizations and individuals across the country. The 2021 Ottawa Centre debate is hosted by Evidence for Democracy, Canada’s leading non-partisan, not-for-profit organization promoting the transparent use of evidence in government decision-making.

Hear where the candidates stand on science and environmental policy, from climate change to conservation and more. Come get to know your potential next Member of Parliament representing Ottawa Centre!

The 2021 Federal Candidates for Ottawa Centre:
Angela Keller-Herzog (Green Party)
Angella MacEwen (NDP)
Carol Clemenhagen (Conservative Party) — Attendance to be confirmed
Yasir Naqvi (Liberal Party)

The debate moderator is to be confirmed.

RSVP for your ticket on Eventbrite to get the Zoom link, or watch the livestream (details to be announced).

Can’t attend? The recording will be made available after the debate.

Join us on Zoom to hear about the environment from the candidates vying to represent Cambridge in the election. This debate, which is one of 100 Debates on the Environment, will focus on the candidates' positions on environmental issues including the climate crisis, greenhouse gas emissions and biodiversity conservation.

The debate will be moderated by Mike Farwell, host of The Mike Farwell Show on 570 News.

Candidates for Cambridge:

Michele Braniff (Green)

Lorne Bruce (NDP) - ATTENDANCE TO BE CONFIRMED

Connie Cody (Conservative) - ATTENDANCE TO BE CONFIRMED

Bryan May (Liberal) - ATTENDANCE TO BE CONFIRMED

This debate is co-hosted by rare Charitable Research Reserve and Reep Green Solutions as part of the 100 Debates on the Environment initiative, a national non-partisan movement coordinated by GreenPAC.

ad_creative_link_caption: Election 2021 and the Climate Emergency: South Okanagan-West Kootenay Forum
ad_creative_link_captions: Election 2021 and the Climate Emergency: South Okanagan-West Kootenay Forum
ad_creative_link_description:
Concerned about the climate crisis? Federal candidates will have an opportunity to discuss climate issues in an online all-candidates forum on September 7 (6-8 pm) for the South Okanagan—West Kootenay riding.

The riding-wide forum, Election 2021 and the Climate Emergency, is being organized by two non-partisan local organizations — Fridays For Future West Kootenay and the Nelson-West Kootenay chapter of Citizens’ Climate Lobby. It is also taking place as part of GreenPAC’s 100 Debates on the Environment, with similar forums happening in communities across Canada around the same time.

It will take place on Zoom, and registration is required: https://bit.ly/SOWK-ClimateForum

ad_creative_bodies:
We're looking for environmental leaders to endorse during the 2021 Federal Election 🇨🇦

In a typical election, our team spends months researching candidates who have demonstrated environmental leadership. With signs pointing to a snap election call soon, we'll only have a few weeks this time around. That's why we need your help to find the top environmental leaders, from all major parties, running for office.

Nominate yourself or someone you know using our self-nomination form or our third-party recommendation form! 

Self-nomination English⛓https://c1s91kizus5.typeform.com/to/wgpWD4i7

Self-nomination French ⛓https://c1s91kizus5.typeform.com/to/wxHfTSvP

Third-party English ⛓https://c1s91kizus5.typeform.com/to/niUYNtB2

Third-party French ⛓https://c1s91kizus5.typeform.com/to/CRPb4iRg

ad_creative_bodies:
🔴NOW LIVE🔴

We’re looking for environmental leaders from all parties to endorse during the 2021 Federal Election 🇨🇦

Our endorsements help drive attention, money and volunteer time to endorsees campaigns. They help candidates to validate their environmental credentials as they talk to voters.

Nominate a candidate (or yourself!) for our endorsement campaign! Link in bio 🔗

#canadianpolitics #canpoli #environmental #leadership

ad_creative_bodies:
This event provides insights on how to work across the different levels of government on environmental issues. This is one of the many challenges environmental advocates face: understanding jurisdictional responsibility and navigating relationships on issues that span jurisdiction. This session is 1 hour long. We have set aside 30 additional minutes afterwards to workshop challenges with attendees. It will cover:

1. Jurisdictional breakdown of environmental issues
2. Practical advice for advocacy on inter-jurisdictional issues
3. Case study examples on how others have worked across the various levels of government on issues that span jurisdictions

There will be opportunity for Q and A as well as to workshop with anyone in the Every Day Advocates network who might be grappling with related challenges.

3. Case study examples on how others have worked across the various levels of government on issues that span jurisdictions

There will be opportunity for Q and A as well as to workshop with anyone in the Every Day Advocates network who might be grappling with related challenges.

Heads-up British Columbians! 

CPAWS-BC, in collaboration with GreenPAC's Everyday Advocates, invites you to join three federal MPs for a Conversation on the Coast. Patrick Weiler, Terry Beech, and Jonathan Wilkinson will share on the progress being made for environmental protection locally and across Canada. The panel will focus on land and ocean conservation, species protection, nature-based solutions to climate change, and economic recovery.
ad_creative_body:
Heads-up British Columbians! 

CPAWS-BC, in collaboration with GreenPAC's Everyday Advocates, invites you to join three federal MPs for a Conversation on the Coast. Patrick Weiler, Terry Beech, and Jonathan Wilkinson will share on the progress being made for environmental protection locally and across Canada. The panel will focus on land and ocean conservation, species protection, nature-based solutions to climate change, and economic recovery.
ad_creative_link_caption: Conversation on the Coast | Townhall on the Environment
ad_creative_link_captions: Conversation on the Coast | Townhall on the Environment
ad_creative_link_description:
Hear from your MP on Canada's goal to protect 30% of lands and ocean by 2030, species at risk, and advancing Indigenous-led conservation

Climate change and biodiversity loss are among the most pressing challenges facing the world today. British Columbians are worried about the future of our communities, which depend on nature for clean air, water, and food. Our federal leaders have set ambitious land, and ocean conservation goals, including support for Indigenous-led protected areas to help stem the nature emergency. But how close are they to meeting those targets?

CPAWS-BC, in collaboration with GreenPAC and Everyday Advocates, invites you to join three federal MPs for a Conversation on the Coast. Patrick Weiler, Terry Beech, and Jonathan Wilkinson will share on the progress being made for environmental protection locally and across Canada. The panel will focus on land and ocean conservation, species protection, nature-based solutions to climate change, and economic recovery.

Constituents from Burnaby to Bowen Island, Lillooet to Lonsdale, and Gambier Island to Garibaldi might be particularly eager to hear from their elected officials. And folks from right across the province can find out what the federal government is working on from Minister for Environment and Climate Change Jonathan Wilkinson and MPs Patrick Weiler and Terry Beech.

Have a question on the environment for your MP? Submit your question for the Q&A when you register.

------------------------------------

DETAILS

→ When: June 29, 6 PM (PT)

→ Where: Register for exclusive access on Zoom where we’ll pose your questions to the MPs.

→ Who: You and your network! This is a no-cost public event. Please share with your friends and neighbours in Burnaby North-Seymour, North Vancouver, and West Vancouver—Sunshine Coast—Sea to Sky Country.

Get your ticket to join the webinar and pose your questions on the environment. A livestream will be available at: facebook.com/CPAWSbc (no account required)

------------------------------------------

PANELISTS

→ Patrick Weiler, Member of Parliament - West Vancouver—Sunshine Coast—Sea to Sky Country

→ Terry Beech, Parliamentary Secretary to the Minister of Fisheries, Oceans and the Canadian Coast Guard and Parliamentary Secretary to the Minister of Economic Development and Official Languages, Member of Parliament - Burnaby North-Seymour

→ The Honourable Jonathan Wilkinson, Minister of Environment and Climate Change, Member of Parliament - North Vancouver

This is a non-partisan discussion featuring federally elected representatives.

------------------------------------------

HOSTS

Annita Mcphee, CPAWS-BC Executive Director

Ross Jameson, CPAWS-BC Ocean Conservation Manager

We give thanks to Míkw'achi7m (Marissa Nahanee), Squamish and Nisga’a Indigenous Ambassador, for welcoming us all to this online space

-----------------------------------------

ACCESSIBILITY

Closed captioning is provided. Join online or dial-in to listen by phone.

This conversation and all comments in the chat will be moderated in accordance with CPAWS-BC community guidelines to ensure mutual respect: cpawsbc.org/community-guidelines. Learn more about CPAWS-BC’s commitment to justice, equity, diversity and inclusion on our website.

Please contact Rippon at info@cpawsbc.org or call 604-685-7445 (ext. 23) with any requests to help you participate in this event.

------------------------------------------

ABOUT US

The Canadian Parks and Wilderness Society - British Columbia (CPAWS-BC) is part of one of Canada’s oldest non-profit conservation groups. We protect wilderness in every corner of BC and deep into the ocean. We have been defending BC since 1978, and are dedicated to keeping BC’s natural environment thriving forever. Nature is BC’s best hope.CPAWS-BC has a plan to stem the nature emergency and ensure resilient ecosystems that can weather the storms of a changing climate. When nature thrives, so do we. Visit: cpawsbc.org or follow us on social media @CPAWSbc

GreenPAC is a Canadian non-profit, non-partisan environmental organization that works to inspire, activate and amplify environment leadership in politics. Every Day Advocates is a GreenPAC initiative.

ad_creative_bodies:
Heads-up Davenport community! Bring your environmental concerns and questions to a virtual Town Hall with Davenport M.P. Julie Dzerowicz hosted by St. Anne's Anglican Church in partnership with Green Wave West and GreenPAC's Every Day Advocates program.
This hour-long Zoom event will feature three short personal statements by Davenport residents related to the environment, each one followed by a question for M.P Julie. There will also be a time for community questions as raised through the chat function of Zoom.
The town hall will be moderated by Carole Giangrande, St. Anne's parishioner, former CBC broadcast journalist, author, and environmentalist.

ad_creative_link_caption: Assemblée virtuelle sur l'environnement / Digital Townhall on the Environment
ad_creative_link_captions: Assemblée virtuelle sur l'environnement / Digital Townhall on the Environment
ad_creative_link_description:
Rejoignez le réseau des défenseurs de tous les jours (DtlJ) pour une assemblée publique l'environnement avec le ministre du Patrimoine canadien, l'hon. Steven Guilbeault. En l'honneur de la journée mondiale de l'abeille le 20 mai, nous mettrons un accent particulier sur les défis auxquels sont confrontés les insectes pollinisateurs. Il y aura également une séance de questions / réponses publiques animée pour permettre aux membres du public de poser leurs propres questions au ministre sur des sujets environnementaux.

----------------------------------------------------------------

Join the everyday advocates (EDA) network for a digital town hall on the environment with
Canada’s heritage minister, the Hon. Steven Guilbeault. In honor of world bee day on May 20th, we will place a particular emphasis on the challenges faced by pollinating insects. There will also be a moderated public Q+A for members of the public to ask their own questions to the minister on environmental topics.
ad_creative_link_descriptions:
Rejoignez le réseau des défenseurs de tous les jours (DtlJ) pour une assemblée publique l'environnement avec le ministre du Patrimoine canadien, l'hon. Steven Guilbeault. En l'honneur de la journée mondiale de l'abeille le 20 mai, nous mettrons un accent particulier sur les défis auxquels sont confrontés les insectes pollinisateurs. Il y aura également une séance de questions / réponses publiques animée pour permettre aux membres du public de poser leurs propres questions au ministre sur des sujets environnementaux.

----------------------------------------------------------------

Join the everyday advocates (EDA) network for a digital town hall on the environment with
Canada’s heritage minister, the Hon. Steven Guilbeault. In honor of world bee day on May 20th, we will place a particular emphasis on the challenges faced by pollinating insects. There will also be a moderated public Q+A for members of the public to ask their own questions to the minister on environmental topics.

Spadina-Fort York community! Don't miss this town hall coming up with your local Members of Parliament (MP), Adam Vaughan on May 19th at 7pm. The event is hosted by Youth Climate Save Toronto as part of GreenPAC's Every Day Advocates initiative.

Every Day Advocates is a community-led movement that builds on GreenPAC's 100 Debates on the Environment to ensure that Canadian politicians, policy makers and elected officials know that the environment matters between elections - every single day. This initiative is working to build a network of Canadians from all regions of the country, across the political spectrum, and supporting them so they can hold our elected officials accountable for the environment. A key goal for Every Day Advocates is to help organizers hold town halls and other engagements with MPs across the country about their leadership for the environment.

ad_creative_link_caption: Rural Economic Development Through Green Innovation and Initiatives
ad_creative_link_captions: Rural Economic Development Through Green Innovation and Initiatives
ad_creative_link_description:
50by30WR and Nith Valley EcoBoosters are collaborating in response to Green PAC’s Every Day Advocates program's challenge to hold an environmental town hall.

The world is changing. People are looking forward to emerging from this pandemic in new courageous ways that recognize we cannot return to “normal”. In fact, we don’t want to return to normal. Investments in infrastructure, business, jobs, social justice, and lifting people out of poverty are part of our conversations on the street and in politics.

So what does our future look like in rural Waterloo Region? What is the vision and what are you and I doing about it? What do we need locally from our elected officials, at all levels of government, to make a successful transition out of the pandemic?

Attend and listen to inspiring stories of how our local community, the community around us, and the rest of the world are creating green new jobs.

Guests:

Kitchener-Conestoga MP Louis

University of Waterloo Director of Economic Development Program, Paul Parker:

Paul is the director of the Economic Development Program and a professor in the Faculty of Environment. His research focuses on building sustainable communities by creating win-win opportunities for the environment and economy. Paul combines his research background with direct experience engaging local representatives from communities across Canada and overseas to envision and build local capacity, vitality and sustainability.

Carolinian Canada Executive Director, Michelle Kanter:

Nature Smart Climate Solutions what is it and what can they do? This is a huge industry right at our fingertips. What does it look like for landowners or even people who have a small yard? There is a lot of money being assigned for nature-based solutions but we need to start planning now. Diverse green jobs are possible.

https://caroliniancanada.ca/cib

Vice President of the Waterloo Federation of Agriculture, Mark Reusser:

Farming and forestry are the two sectors, in all of the Canadian economy, that have the potential to sequester carbon. Neither the provincial nor the federal gov't are willing to acknowledge that farming is the answer to the problem of mass carbon sequestration. There need to be incentives for farmers to participate in research in order to build this momentum. There is an ever-growing need for physical labour as well as highly skilled labour. Farmland in Waterloo Region is the best combination of land, climate and skilled labour.

Bring you bold ideas for climate action and a just transition for a livable future. Be prepared to ask our elected officials and guests what rural Waterloo Region needs to build better.

Courage calls on courage everywhere.

ad_creative_link_caption: Etobicoke Climate Town Hall w/ MPs Maloney & Baker
ad_creative_link_captions: Etobicoke Climate Town Hall w/ MPs Maloney & Baker
ad_creative_link_description:
Join local MPs James Maloney (Etobicoke Lakeshore) and Yvan Baker (Etobicoke Centre) for a town hall discussion and update about the federal government's action to address the climate crisis. The update will be followed by a Q&A period to allow you to ask any questions you have for the MPs regarding the climate crisis and efforts to address it.

RSVP at EtobicokeClimate.ca

This event is a joint partnership between the Mimico Resident's Association, Eculinks Etobicoke, GreenPAC, and the Citizen's Climate Lobby. All are welcome!

Where do Greater Sudbury’s Local Representatives stand on the Transition to Net-zero?

reThink Green, Fridays for Future and Citizens' Climate Lobby are co-hosting the Every Day Advocates event for Sudbury and Nickel Belt riding on May 17, 6:30 pm to 7:30 pm. MP Paul Lefebvre, MP Marc Serre and MPP Jamie West will be in attendance to respond to follow-up questions from 100 Debates on the Environment that occurred in October 2019 and answer any questions you may have in regards to the transition to Net-Zero in Sudbury and Nickel Belt.

Every Day Advocates is a community-led movement that builds on GreenPAC's 100 Debates on the Environment to ensure that Canadian politicians, policy makers and elected officials know that the environment matters between elections - every single day. This initiative is working to build a network of Canadians from all regions of the country, across the political spectrum, and supporting them so they can hold our elected officials accountable for the environment. A key goal for Every Day Advocates is to help organizers hold town halls and other engagements with MPs across the country about their leadership for the environment.

Please submit any questions you may have to the MPs & MPP in this survey here: https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/CRC7WZK

Capacity is limited, the event session will be recorded and put onto the reThink Green YouTube page.

Any questions or concerns, please e-mail angela.jiang@rethinkgreen.ca

ad_creative_bodies:
Come join UMSU, UMSU Green Team, Science First & GreenPAC for a Zoom Webinar with Q & A.

-The event is open to the public/members of each constituency and are focused on the environment.

-UMSU Green Team's aim is to promote and educate people on and around the campus of the University of Manitoba about the sustainable use of resources.

-GreenPAC is a non-partisan, non-profit that aims to promote environmentally conscious elected officials. Every Day Advocates is a GreenPAC program

-Science First is a Winnipeg based non-profit that organizes events and media campaigns that promote science literacy, publicly funded science, ecological conservation and evidence based policies. Science First is a non-partisan advocacy group that aims to reduce and counter disinformation & misinformation to better strengthen our democracy.

-This specific Town Hall will have a sustainability theme and we'll be taking questions from attendees related to the MP's plans to promote environmental responsibility in the commons. As well, there will be questions on their plans for specific environmental concerns in their constituencies.
